content: I am currently processing in the U.S. Army and have a few questions about BCT. First off, what determines where you go for basic. Is it your MOS or is it maybe where they have an opening. If it is your MOS, maybe someone in 15 Tango can help me with this question. Just thought I would ask. Any feedback is greatly appreciated. Kyle Jett

title: Boot Camp

content: No, it doesn't matter. You could end up at FTsill, Benning, Jackson for Basic. You could try asking in the Army forum, look for Aviation Branch.

content: quote: Originally posted by ArmyOfOne15R: I am currently processing in the U.S. Army and have a few questions about BCT. First off, what determines where you go for basic. Is it your MOS or is it maybe where they have an opening. If it is your MOS, maybe someone in 15 Tango can help me with this question. Just thought I would ask. Any feedback is greatly appreciated. Kyle Jett It does have somewhat to do with your MOS. I enlisted for Armor and was sent to Ft. Knox for both BCT and AIT. Infantry was a little more general. People could be sent to Ft. Ord (now gone), Ft. Kampbell, and a lot of others, then end up at Ft. Polk Louisiana for final Infantry AIT. Obviously, they'll send you where there are a lotof helicopters eventually - - Wandering and Wondering
quote: Originally posted by ArmyOfOne15R: I am currently processing in the U.S. Army and have a few questions about BCT. First off, what determines where you go for basic. Is it your MOS or is it maybe where they have an opening. If it is your MOS, maybe someone in 15 Tango can help me with this question. Just thought I would ask. Any feedback is greatly appreciated. Kyle Jett
reply: It does have somewhat to do with your MOS. I enlisted for Armor and was sent to Ft. Knox for both BCT and AIT. Infantry was a little more general. People could be sent to Ft. Ord (now gone), Ft. Kampbell, and a lot of others, then end up at Ft. Polk Louisiana for final Infantry AIT. Obviously, they'll send you where there are a lotof helicopters eventually - - Wandering and Wondering
title: Boot Camp

content: A 1-1 Infantry training, A 2-1 Mortars, 7&7 then straight to Nam. I'll never forget Fort Ord and the Ice plant. In any event, Ya go where the Army needs Ya. Most of the time! Got money for everything but "VETERANS" Same old story!

title: Boot Camp

content: Kyle, consider yourself lucky that Fort Knox no longer does BCT. There are alot of factors that go into deciding where you will go to basic. MOS is one, what state you're from, same sex or co-ed, WHEN you will be going, openings, etc. One thing you will learn during your time in the Army is that it is different for everyone, there are rarely any that have the exact same path... so my best advice is just educate yourself on all of the different options before you and wait for your orders. Good Luck!
reply: Kyle, consider yourself lucky that Fort Knox no longer does BCT. There are alot of factors that go into deciding where you will go to basic. MOS is one, what state you're from, same sex or co-ed, WHEN you will be going, openings, etc. One thing you will learn during your time in the Army is that it is different for everyone, there are rarely any that have the exact same path... so my best advice is just educate yourself on all of the different options before you and wait for your orders. Good Luck!
